meanings.definition: An uncomfortable feeling in the body
meanings.sent1: After sitting for hours, he felt a sharp discomfort in his back.
meanings.sent2: The discomfort in her stomach made her realize she was hungry.
meanings.sent3: The uncomfortable discomfort in his shoes made him dance awkwardly.
meanings.sent4: The discomfort of the tight rope around his waist was a constant reminder of the challenge ahead.
meanings.sent5: The discomfort of the scratchy fabric against her skin was unbearable.

meanings.sent1: The loud noise discomforted the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent2: His sudden change in behavior discomforted his friends.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected prank discomforted him, but he couldn't help but laugh.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence discomforted her, making her feel uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds discomforted the children, hinting at an impending storm.

meanings.sent1: The discomfort of the hard chair made the meeting unbearable.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't ignore the discomfort of the cold draft in the room.
meanings.sent3: The discomfort of the bumpy road made the car ride feel like a rollercoaster.
meanings.sent4: The discomfort of the cramped airplane seat made the long flight seem endless.
meanings.sent5: The discomfort of the itchy sweater distracted her during the presentation.
